\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxlineitem{find\_all\_pdf\_urls(csv\_file):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Find and return all PDF URLs in a CSV file.

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A class for processing Excel files, generating reports, and integrating data from CSV files.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Attributes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
input\_file (str): The path to the input Excel file.
output\_file (str): The path to the output Excel file.
csv\_directory (str): The directory where CSV files are stored.

\sphinxlineitem{Methods:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\_fill\_row(row, fill\_color):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Fill cells in a row with a specified fill color.

\sphinxlineitem{\_add\_to\_row(sheet, row\_index, num\_cols, found\_pdfs):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Add data to a row in an Excel sheet based on the presence of PDF URLs.

\sphinxlineitem{\_process\_csv\_files(sheet, num\_rows, num\_cols):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Process CSV files associated with the Excel sheet and update cell fill colors accordingly.

\sphinxlineitem{process\_excel():}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Process the input Excel file, integrate data from CSV files, and generate an output Excel file.

\end{description}

\end{description}

\section{WebCrawler module}
\label{\detokenize{crawler:module-crawler}}\label{\detokenize{crawler:webcrawler-module}}\label{\detokenize{crawler::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!crawler@\spxentry{crawler}}\index{crawler@\spxentry{crawler}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{WebCrawler (class in crawler)@\spxentry{WebCrawler}\spxextra{class in crawler}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{crawler:crawler.WebCrawler}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{crawler.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{WebCrawler}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A web crawler class for scraping and processing web content.
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Attributes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\_MAX\_RETRIES (int): Maximum number of retries for fetching a URL.
\_RETRY\_DELAY (int): Number of seconds to wait between retries.
driver (webdriver.Chrome): Selenium WebDriver for web scraping.
link\_queue (queue.Queue): Queue for managing URLs to be scraped.
visited (set): Set to keep track of visited URLs.
ignore\_list (list): List of URLs to be ignored during crawling.

\sphinxlineitem{Methods:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{set\_ignorelist\_url():}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read a list of URLs from ‘WebCrawler/resources/ignoreUrls.csv’ and set it as the ignore list.

\sphinxlineitem{setup\_headless\_chrome():}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Set up and configure a headless Chrome WebDriver for web scraping.

\sphinxlineitem{get\_html\_content(url):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Fetch the HTML content of a URL, handling retries and waiting for page load.

\sphinxlineitem{has\_product(html\_content):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check if the HTML content contains product\sphinxhyphen{}related information.

\sphinxlineitem{is\_pdf(url):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check if a URL points to a PDF file.

\sphinxlineitem{clean\_html\_content(html\_content):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clean the HTML content by removing specified elements and extracting text.

\sphinxlineitem{remove\_all\_children(element):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Remove all child elements from a BeautifulSoup element.

\sphinxlineitem{find\_valid\_links(html\_content):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Find valid links in the HTML content.

\sphinxlineitem{is\_valid\_link(url):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check if a URL is valid for crawling, considering file extensions and other criteria.

\sphinxlineitem{save\_content\_to\_csv(content, csv\_filename):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Save content to a CSV file in the ‘temp\_files’ folder.

\sphinxlineitem{is\_search\_engine\_url(url):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check if a URL belongs to a search engine and should be skipped during crawling.

\sphinxlineitem{extract\_search\_engine\_links(html\_content):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Extract search engine result links from HTML content.

\sphinxlineitem{crawl\_website\_with\_depth(csv\_filename, depth\_limit, start\_url):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Crawl a website up to a specified depth, saving content to a CSV file.

\sphinxlineitem{close():}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Close the Selenium WebDriver instance.

\end{description}

\end{description}

\section{ExcelIdentifier module}
\label{\detokenize{excelidentify:module-excelidentify}}\label{\detokenize{excelidentify:excelidentifier-module}}\label{\detokenize{excelidentify::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!excelidentify@\spxentry{excelidentify}}\index{excelidentify@\spxentry{excelidentify}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{ExcelManip (class in excelidentify)@\spxentry{ExcelManip}\spxextra{class in excelidentify}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{excelidentify:excelidentify.ExcelManip}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{excelidentify.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ExcelManip}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{data\_file}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{brands\_file}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}resources/Brands.xlsx\textquotesingle{}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A class for processing Excel data and extracting information from it.
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Attributes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
data\_file (str): The path to the Excel file containing the data to be processed.
brands\_file (str): The path to the Excel file containing brand names (default: ‘resources/Brands.xlsx’).
brand\_names (list): A list of brand names loaded from the brands\_file.

\sphinxlineitem{Methods:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{\_load\_brands(self):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Load brand names from the ‘brands\_file’ Excel file and return them as a list.

\sphinxlineitem{\_identify\_brands(self, input\_string):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Identify brand names in the input string and return the modified string with the brand removed
and the identified brand name (if any).

\sphinxlineitem{\_identify\_rsk(s):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Identify 7\sphinxhyphen{}digit numbers in the input string and return the modified string with the numbers removed
and a list of identified numbers (if any).

\sphinxlineitem{\_identify\_column(row, column\_name):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Identify a specific column’s value in a DataFrame row, remove it, and return the modified row
along with the extracted value.

\sphinxlineitem{clean\_row(row):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Clean and format a row by converting NaN values to empty strings and joining the row elements into a string.

\sphinxlineitem{pre\_process(self):}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Process the data from the ‘data\_file’ Excel file and extract relevant information.
Return the processed data as a list of dictionaries, where each dictionary represents a row of data.

\end{description}

\end{description}
\index{clean\_row() (excelidentify.ExcelManip static method)@\spxentry{clean\_row()}\spxextra{excelidentify.ExcelManip static method}}

\end{fulllineitems}
